intro: Diclidanthera laurifolia, commonly known as the laurel-leaved diclidanthera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often glossy and arranged alternately along the stems. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically in yellow or orange hues, adding to its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
